macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Stock Market Closes Mixed After Microsoft Earnings Disappointment
items.summary: Major U.S. indices finished Thursday with modest moves after dramatic intraday swings. The S&P 500 fell 0.1%, the Dow rose 0.1%, and the Nasdaq declined 0.7%, as Microsoft's worst day in years was partially offset by Meta's strong performance.

items.title: Microsoft Tumbles Nearly 10% on Disappointing Earnings and AI Spending Concerns
items.summary: Microsoft experienced its worst trading day in years, dropping nearly 10% following earnings results that disappointed investors due to concerns about AI spending commitments. The decline weighed heavily on the Nasdaq composite.

items.title: Meta Platforms Surges 8.58% on Strong AI Spending Outlook
items.summary: Meta exceeded investor expectations and gained 8.58% after announcing plans for larger AI spending in 2026 as part of its superintelligence efforts, helping to offset broader tech sector weakness.

items.title: Big Tech Earnings Drive Market Volatility; Additional Reports Expected
items.summary: Earnings season continued with significant moves from major technology companies. Apple, Visa, Mastercard, and Caterpillar were scheduled to report earnings on Thursday, with additional reports expected after market close.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: $1.68 Billion in Crypto Liquidations as Bitcoin Drops to $83K and Ether to $2.8K
items.summary: The crypto market experienced a sharp sell-off with $1.681 billion in liquidations, mostly long positions, affecting over 270,000 traders. The largest liquidation was an $80.6 million BTC-USDT position on HTX.

items.title: $8.8 Billion Bitcoin and Ethereum Options Expire Today Amid Bitcoin's Struggle Below $90K
items.summary: Roughly $8.8 billion in Bitcoin and Ethereum options are expiring on January 30, 2026, with Bitcoin at $82,761 and facing downside protection demand despite bullish positioning. Implied volatility is fading, increasing liquidity risks.

items.title: Bitcoin Faces Fourth Straight Red Month with $81K Support Level in Focus
items.summary: Bitcoin is poised for its fourth consecutive red monthly close, with the $81,000 level emerging as a critical support amid ongoing market pressure.

items.title: President Trump Expected to Announce Next Fed Chair Today, Impacting Crypto
items.summary: On January 30, 2026, President Trump is set to name the next Federal Reserve Chair, whose policies on inflation, growth, and regulation could significantly affect Bitcoin and crypto markets.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: New Light-Emitting Artificial Neurons Enable Scalable 3D AI Neural Networks
items.summary: Researchers developed memristive blinking neurons with a tiny footprint of 170 nm × 240 nm, achieving 91.51% accuracy on Google Speech classification and 92.27% on MNIST digit recognition in photonically linked 3D networks. This breakthrough could lead to denser, more efficient AI hardware published in Nature Electronics.

items.title: Global AI Chip Market Projected to Reach $118 Billion by 2030
items.summary: The AI chip market, valued at $21.30 billion in 2024, is expected to grow at a 33.03% CAGR, driven by AI adoption in automotive, healthcare, and edge computing. Key players like Intel plan to ship 100 million AI PC processors by 2025.

items.title: CIOs Shift AI Agenda in 2026 Toward Financial Responsibility and Regulation
items.summary: CIOs face pressure to align AI with budgets amid market corrections, Europe's AI Act enforcement, and risks like synthetic content manipulation. Priorities include redesigning software engineering with AI agents while embedding compliance.

items.title: Travelers Insurance Scales AI in Contact Centers, Automates Millions of Transactions
items.summary: Travelers announced AI assistants for 10,000 engineers and data scientists, with dozens of generative AI tools in production and agentic AI embedded in operations. The company advances to 'Innovation 2.0' powered by AI and future quantum computing.

items.title: Databricks Highlights Hidden Technical Debt in GenAI Systems
items.summary: Generative AI introduces unique technical debt compared to classical ML, emphasizing needs for better communication, monitoring, and maintainable systems to prevent long-term issues.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Code Vein 2 Releases Today
items.summary: Code Vein 2 launches today on PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC, marking a major release for January 2026.

items.title: World of Warcraft Housing System Gets Unexpected Features
items.summary: Blizzard has announced upcoming unexpected features for WoW's housing system as part of the development plan following the Midnight expansion.

items.title: Fable Reboot Coming to PlayStation 5 for First Time
items.summary: The upcoming Fable reboot, launching in Autumn 2026, will release on PlayStation 5 alongside Xbox platforms—a franchise first that reflects Microsoft's expanded multi-platform strategy.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Tesla Reports First Full-Year Revenue Decline, Pivots to AI and Robotics
items.summary: Tesla reported its first full-year revenue decline and a 46% profit slump, prompting the company to accelerate its strategic pivot toward AI, robotics, and autonomous technology, including a $2 billion investment in xAI and production cuts for high-end vehicle models.

items.title: SK Hynix Surpasses Samsung in Annual Operating Profit
items.summary: SK Hynix surpassed Samsung Electronics in annual operating profit for the first time, driven by record financial results fueled by robust demand for High Bandwidth Memory (HBM).

items.title: Memory Chipmakers Warn of Supply Crunch Until 2027
items.summary: Samsung and SK Hynix warned that extreme demand is expected to cause a severe memory chip supply crunch until 2027, with both companies planning price increases of up to 100% for certain memory products.

items.title: ASML Reports €32.7 Billion Sales Amid Strong Chipmaker Demand
items.summary: ASML reported €32.7 billion in sales and €9.6 billion in income, driven by big orders as AI fuels chipmaker demand, though the company announced plans to lay off 1,700 employees.

items.title: Google Agrees to $135 Million Android Data-Harvesting Settlement
items.summary: Google agreed to pay $135 million in a settlement related to collecting Android users' data without proper consent.
